Item 1. Business.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - Item 1. Business section of ABNB in bullet points:

• 2007: The year when two hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, marking the birth of Airbnb's community-based platform.
• Over 5 million hosts have joined the platform since its inception.
• Over 2 billion guest arrivals have taken place on the platform across almost every country and region globally.
• $3 million: The maximum amount of property damage protection offered by AirCover for Hosts.
• $1 million: The maximum liability coverage offered to hosts in the event of third-party claims of personal injury or property damage through AirCover for Hosts.

Item 1A. Risk Factors.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART I - Item 1A. Risk Factors section of ABNB's Annual Report on Form 10-K, formatted as bullet points:

• The company's revenue growth rate is subject to risks, including changes in supply and demand for listings on its platform and the development and adoption of new offerings and initiatives.

• A softening of supply or demand for current or future offerings could result in decreased revenue and negatively impact the company's business, results of operations, and financial condition.

• The company's success is heavily reliant on hosts and guests engaging with its platform, and any failure to meet expectations or choose to cross-list with competitors could adversely affect revenue and business operations.

• External factors such as pandemics, political instability, climate change, and economic downturns can impact the company's ability to attract and retain guests.

• Negative perceptions or incidents related to safety, security, or quality can harm the company's public image and business operations.

• The development and delivery of new offerings and initiatives increase expenses and organizational complexity, and there is a high degree of risk involved in developing and implementing these initiatives.

Item 1C. Cybersecurity.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART I - Item 1C. Cybersecurity section in bullet points:

• ABNB has a cybersecurity risk management program intended to protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of its critical systems and information.
• The program includes a cybersecurity incident response plan (Incident Response Plan) that outlines procedures for recognizing and responding to cybersecurity incidents.
• ABNB's cybersecurity risk management program is integrated into its overall enterprise risk management program and shares common methodologies with other risk areas.
• The program includes:
  • Risk assessments to identify material cybersecurity risks
  • An information security team that manages and maintains the program, including incident response procedures
  • Cybersecurity awareness training for employees, incident response personnel, and senior management
  • A third-party risk management process for service providers, suppliers, and vendors with access to critical systems and information
• ABNB's board of directors considers cybersecurity risk as part of its risk oversight function and has delegated oversight to the Audit Risk and Compliance Committee.
• The Audit Committee receives regular reports and briefings on cybersecurity risks and updates from management on the cybersecurity risk management program.
• ABNB's management team, including the Chief Legal Officer, Chief Security Officer, and Chief Technology Officer, is responsible for assessing and managing material risks from cybersecurity threats.

Item 2. Properties.summary:
Here are the key facts extracted from PART I - Item 2. Properties section:

• ABNB is headquartered in San Francisco, California.
• The company has lease commitments for approximately 0.8 million square feet across multiple buildings.
• As of December 31, 2024, ABNB leased office facilities totaling approximately 1.5 million square feet.
• Approximately 0.9 million square feet of these leased facilities are offered for sublease.

Item 3. Legal Proceedings.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART I - Item 3. Legal Proceedings section in bullet points:

• ABNB is currently involved in and may be involved in future legal proceedings, claims, and government investigations.
• The legal proceedings relate to various matters including regulatory, commercial, intellectual property, competition, tax, employment, pricing, discrimination, consumer rights, personal injury, and property rights.
• Monetary damage awards, fines, penalties, or injunctive orders are possible outcomes of these proceedings.
• The outcome of these matters could materially adversely affect ABNB's business, results of operations, and financial condition.
• The likelihood and amount of loss related to these matters are inherently unpredictable and subject to significant judgment.

Item 5. Market for Registrant’s Common E.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - Item 5. Market for Registrant’s Common Equity, Related Stockholder Matters and Issuer Purchases of Equity Securities in bullet points:

• Our Class A common stock has been listed on the Nasdaq Global Select Market under the symbol “ABNB” since December 10, 2020.
• As of January 31, 2025, there were 905 stockholders of record for our Class A common stock.
• There were 74 stockholders of record for our Class B common stock as of January 31, 2025.
• Our Class C and Class H common stocks are neither listed nor publicly traded.
• As of December 31, 2024, we repurchased approximately $1.3 billion worth of our Class A common stock at an average price per share of $148.41.
• We have a share repurchase program authorization to purchase up to 6.0 billion shares of our Class A common stock at management's discretion.

Item 7. Management’s Discussion and Anal.summary:
Here are the key facts from the Management's Discussion and Analysis section in bullet points:

• Revenue increased by 12% to $11.1 billion in 2024 compared to 2023.
• Nights and Experiences Booked increased by 10% to 43.3 million in 2024.
• Gross Booking Value (GBV) increased by 12% to $8.5 billion in 2024.
• Net income decreased by 45% to $2.6 billion in 2024 compared to 2023.
• The company repurchased an aggregate of 24.5 million shares of Class A common stock for $3.4 billion in 2024.
• Adjusted EBITDA increased by 11% to $4.0 billion in 2024.
• Net cash provided by operating activities was $4.5 billion in 2024, compared to $3.9 billion in the prior year.
• Free Cash Flow was $4.5 billion for the year ended December 31, 2024, compared to $3.8 billion in the prior year.

Item 7A. Quantitative and Qualitative Di.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - Item 7A. Quantitative and Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk in bullet points:

• ABNB offers transactions on its platform in approximately 50 currencies.
• The most significant foreign currencies to ABNB's operations in 2024 were the Euro, British pound, Canadian dollar, Australian dollar, Brazilian real, and Mexican peso.
• ABNB is subject to foreign currency risk due to fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates against the U.S. dollar, which may adversely impact its financial results.
• Foreign currency exchange risks are related to:
 - Revenue and cost of revenue associated with bookings on the platform denominated in currencies other than the U.S. dollar;
 - Balances held as funds receivable and amounts held on behalf of customers and funds payable and amounts payable to customers;
 - Unbilled amounts for confirmed bookings under the Pay Less Upfront program;
 - Intercompany balances primarily related to payment entities that process customer payments.
• If an adverse 10% foreign currency exchange rate change was applied to total net monetary assets and liabilities denominated in currencies other than the local currencies as of December 31, 2024, it would have resulted in a loss of approximately $28 million.
• ABNB has cash and cash equivalents of $6.9 billion and short-term investments of $3.7 billion as of December 31, 2024.
• The company is exposed to interest rate risk related primarily to its investment portfolio, which affects the interest earned on its total cash, cash equivalents, available-for-sale short-term investments, and the fair value of those securities.

Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplem.summary:
Here are the key facts from the PART II - Item 8. Financial Statements and Supplementary Data section in bullet points:

• The auditor's office audited the consolidated balance sheets of Airbnb, Inc. and its subsidiaries as of December 31, 2024 and 2023.
• The auditor also audited the related consolidated statements of operations, comprehensive income, stockholders' equity, and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2024.
• The auditor expressed opinions that the consolidated financial statements present fairly, in all material respects, the financial position of Airbnb, Inc. as of December 31, 2024 and 2023, and the results of its operations and cash flows for each of the three years in the period ended December 31, 2024.
• The auditor also expressed an opinion that Airbnb, Inc. maintained effective internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2024.
• The auditor's audit was conducted in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (PCAOB).
• The auditor performed procedures to assess the risks of material misstatement and evaluated the accounting principles used by management.
• The auditor obtained an understanding of internal control over financial reporting and assessed the risk that a material weakness exists.

Item 9A. Controls and Procedures.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART II - Item 9A. Controls and Procedures section in bullet points:

• As of December 31, 2024, ABNB's principal executive officer and principal financial officer concluded that the company's disclosure controls and procedures were effective.
• The effectiveness of ABNB's internal control over financial reporting as of December 31, 2024 was audited by PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, an independent registered public accounting firm.
• There were no changes in ABNB's internal control over financial reporting during the quarter ended December 31, 2024 that materially affected its effectiveness.
• ABNB's disclosure controls and procedures are designed to provide reasonable assurance of achieving their desired objectives, but management does not expect them to prevent or detect all errors and fraud.

Item 10. Directors, Executive Officers a.summary:
Here are the key facts from PART III - Item 10. Directors, Executive Officers and Corporate Governance in bullet points:

• The Company has adopted a Code of Ethics that applies to its officers, directors, and employees.
• The Code of Ethics is available on the Company's website (investors.airbnb.com) under "Governance".
• The Company intends to disclose amendments to its Code of Ethics on its website within 120 days after December 31, 2024.
• The Company has adopted insider trading policies and procedures governing the purchase, sale, and other dispositions of its securities by directors, officers, and employees.
